title: NZers with recent ping issues: Figured out a way around it!
body:
So I too logged on today, played a ranked game, and a normal game, lost both horribly, baffled as to why my latency is at ~250 when it's normally at a stable 50. 

Then I figured, since this must be a routing issue, I'll try use a VPN! So I logged onto my Battleping account, routed to the Sydney server --> logged onto LoL, and voila! 50 ping again!

Hopefully it works for you! If you don't want to use battleping, which costs money, you can try WTFast :). It's free ^^.

GLHF <3

Have you tried turning inter leaving off? its done through your ISP.

quote from my ISP "If having low latency (or ping) is important to you might want to turn interleaving off - especially for online gaming."

But there are downsides to having it off. Here is a speal about it:

Interleaving is basically a way to arrange data to protect against burst errors, which happen rarely but can disrupt data transmission when they do occur. The downside to having interleaving enabled is that it increases latency (i.e. it slows down the connection).

Think of interleaving using a sieve for flour. The smaller the gaps in the sieve (interleaving on) then the better lower chance that there are bugs (errors) getting through. The bigger the gaps (interleaving off) then the higher the chance of bugs getting into the mix. This will also affect the speed of the connection - the smaller gaps mean the flour takes longer to flow through.

I'm gunna get mine turned off because idc about dl speed as PING is way more important to me. Hope this helps.
